author: Cortex XSOAR

automation.description: Evaluates an ML model in production.
automation.name: EvaluateMLModllAtProduction

automation.description:
Hash fields from the incident list.
Search for incidents by arguments with an option to hash some of its fields.
automation.name: HashIncidentsFields

automation.description: Exports an existing ML model to a file.
automation.name: ExportMLModel

automation.description: A helper script for the DBot Create Phishing Classifier V2 playbook. This script extends the query based on the phishingLabels argument.
automation.name: ExtendQueryBasedOnPhishingLabels

automation.description: Imports a file that contains an ML model.
automation.name: ImportMLModel

automation.description: Predict phishing incidents using the out-of-the-box pre-trained model.
automation.name: DBotPredictOutOfTheBoxV2

automation.description: Apply a trained ML model on multiple incidents at once, to compare incidents how the incidents were labeled by analysts, to the predictions of the model. This script is aimed to help evaluate a trained model using past incidents.
automation.name: DBotPredictIncidentsBatch

playbook.description: Train the phishing machine learning model. This playbook should be used as job, to run repeatedly, for example every week.
playbook.name: DBot Create Phishing Classifier V2 Job

playbook.description: Create a phishing classifier using machine learning techniques, based on email content.
playbook.name: DBot Create Phishing Classifier V2

playbook.description: Create a phishing classifier using machine learning. The classifier is based on incidents files extracted from email content.
playbook.name: DBot Create Phishing Classifier V2 From File

description: Help to manage machine learning models in Cortex XSOAR
name: Machine Learning
